SEARCH
Module melange.common
Package gbw.melange.common.mesh

Interface IManagedMesh

All Superinterfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
public interface IManagedMesh extends com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
Represents a mesh, albeit with a focus on processing and modification rather than memory and performance. Additionally, facilitates processing the mesh in parallel while still using the earlier copy. Has the same caching mechanisms as the managed shaders so the performance during runtime is almost as good as a plain Mesh.
Comes in 2 flavours: Modifiable (datatable retained) and unmodifiable (datatable dropped), which can be checked using isModifiable()

    • applyModifiers

      void applyModifiers(boolean dropDataTable, boolean modifyDataTable) throws MeshProcessingIssue
      Apply any current modifiers registered to the mesh in the order of registration, and store the resulting mesh for further use.
      If this is a one time thing, consider dropping the current vertex data table to use less memory.
      If you choose to drop the underlying datatable, no further modifications can be done to this mesh and a UnmodifiableMeshIssue will be thrown if attempted.
      You can also choose to keep the modified data table. This is an exclusive option, and void if you also choose to drop it.
      Parameters:
      dropDataTable - yes / no, default = no
      modifyDataTable - yes / no, default = no
      Throws:
      MeshProcessingIssue

    • clearModifiers

      void clearModifiers()
      Clear the current modifier list.

    • copyAndApply

      IManagedMesh copyAndApply(boolean copyDataTable) throws MeshProcessingIssue
      Apply the modifiers of this mesh, but store the result as a new instance which is then returned as the result.
      You can choose to either copy as unmodifiable by not including a copy of the data table in the copy as well.
      Parameters:
      copyDataTable - yes/no, default = yes.
      Throws:
      MeshProcessingIssue
